intro: [WRONG START] Silene verecundra var. eglandulosa, commonly known as the glandular silene, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has a compact, herbaceous growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine, glandular hairs, which give it its varietal name. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch to its native environment.
